input.name: arr Dyten - Dhampir Moon Creation Bardruid 6-2 ac16

attacks.description: Druid Wild Shapes, no swimming, no flying CR 0 - Badger, Cat, Rat, Spider, Weasel. Badger. CR 1/8 - Camel, Giant Rat, Giant Weasel, Mastiff, Mule. CR 1/4 - Giant Badger, Giant Wolf Spider, Riding Horse, Velociraptor, Wolf. Cow, Panther. CR 1/2 - Ape, Warhorse. CR 1 - Brn Bear, Dr Wolf, Gnt Hyena, Gnt Spider.

input.backstory: You are a member of a blessed community, built on the ideals of harmony. Here, nature and civilization coexist peacefully. living and growing in accordance with the will of the Worldsoul, Mat’Selesnya. As a member of the Selesnya Conclave, you are surrounded by people and other creatures who share your worldview and your longing for deeper spiritual communion with the world, and you have a fervent desire to share the joy you have experienced with Ravnica. Along with the rest of the conclave, you are committed to resisting the ambitions of the other guilds- with military force if necessary.
input.background-trinket: A gold coin minted in a fallen civilization
input.background-traits: I would rather make a friend than thwart an enemy. Nature offers rich and abundant metaphors for understanding the complexities of life.
input.background-ideals: Humility. Ambition and pride are the roots of strife. (Good)
input.background-bonds: I’ll sing the invitation of Mat’Selesnya with my dying breath.
input.background-flaws: I assume that people mean well until they prove otherwise.

feature.name: Trauma Survivor
feature.description: You survived. Whatever it was, you made it through, and you can help others do the same. People view you as an expert on the traumatic situation you faced—be it a specific sort of violence, illness, or otherwise. You are aware of nonmagical recovery techniques, common resources, and misinformation. You know how to speak to sympathetic doctors, clergy, and local leaders and can convince them to shelter one person (other than yourself) at a modest lifestyle for up to one month.

element.name: Background
element.element: I would rather make a friend than thwart an enemy.
Nature offers rich and abundant metaphors for understanding the complexities of life.
Humility. Ambition and pride are the roots of strife. (Good)
I’ll sing the invitation of Mat’Selesnya with my dying breath.
I assume that people mean well until they prove otherwise.
